subject: Re: [junit] how to test java objects created from XML file
msgSnippet: ... I second Eric s suggestion: one usually needs to be able to create model objects from the XML at some point, anyway. One of the great things about using
messageBody:
Quoting Eric Heikkila <ericheikkila@...>:

> Why would you need to extend the Assert class? Just
> make an equals() method in the helper and your main
> class, and do an assertEquals(helper, testObject).
>
> Or am I misunderstanding what it is you are trying to
> accomplish?

I second Eric's suggestion: one usually needs to be able to create model
objects from the XML at some point, anyway. One of the great things about using
JUnit is that it encourages us to build equals(), hashCode() and toString() to
do useful things in our objects. How many times have you tried to debug
something and wished that the author had simply implemented toString() do tell
you something useful?


J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
President, Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Let's write software that people understand.
